page.title: 02OTLEY AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE
page.content: The East Suffolk College of Agriculture and Horticulture is a demonstration farm situated at Otley. It is made up of Charity Farm and Stanaway Farm and these are for the practice of improved techniques and development in agriculture. Charity Farm provides field training in farm skills and demonstration plots, crops and livestock for teaching purposes. The area of land, about 330 acres, is well drained chalky boulder clay. This supports a rotation of crops from winter wheat to oil seed rape. There is also a calf-rearing unit, producing 280 12 week-old calves per year and an intensive beef unit which finishes about 100 animals per year. The Teaching Farm area of 30 acres provides grazing and hay for about 100 ewes and 50 sows.
